alert.note: Alert for Gove (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 03 at 9:30PM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Gove County through 1000 PM CDT... At 929 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 10 miles south of Gove, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southeastern Gove County. This includes Interstate 70 in Kansas between mile markers 112 and 113. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
